titles.title: Military Family Peace-of-Mind Act
To provide that the Secretary of Defense may provide public identification of military casualties no sooner than 24 hours after notification of next-of-kin.
Military Family Peace-of-Mind Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Total Force.

bill.summary: Military Family Peace-of-Mind Act - Prohibits the Secretary of Defense from publicly releasing the name or any other personally identifying information of any member of the armed forces who while on active duty or performing inactive duty for training is killed or injured, whose duty status becomes unknown, or who is otherwise considered a casualty, until 24 hours has elapsed after notification of the next-of-kin of such member.
